page.title: 05THE FELON SOW
page.content: Ralph Rokeby, who lived at Rokeby in Tudor times, had a formidable sow. From her lair in Mortham Woods she terrorised the neighbourhood so she was given to the Friars of Richmond for their larder, provided they caught her. Friar Middleton and two friends, armed for a dangerous expedition, set out to accomplish the capture. Their quarry was located, and after a long struggle roped by Peter Dale, whereon it charged him, squealing so fiercely the Friar thought it possessed by an evil spirit and began to exorcise it. Friar's Latin was more than the sow could stand so she turned her attack on him, forcing him to shin up the nearest tree. At evening Friar and friends returned empty handed to Richmond. Next day another party of hungry Friars set out and after an epic struggle overcame the sow.
